            (ALL COUNTRIES IN SOUTH ASIA/ALL SECTORS AN,TF040839-BANGLADESH: PRIMARY EDUCATION PROJECT

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings convey satisfactory project
            outcomes, likely sustainability, but modes institutional
            development impacts. Lessons address the following. On
            project preparation, it is suggested to ensure sufficient
            political commitment to the program approach, particularly
            on development objectives; an adequate institutional
            capacity, and, most importantly, effective planning and
            management, including regarding the coordination of
            capabilities; and, a focus on key performance indicators,
            with realistic targets. Regarding project implementation,
            recommendations include developing sustainable capacity
            building for the sector, and, to ensure quality, and
            effective management of staff development and teacher
            training activities, the roles and responsibilities of all
            the institutions involved should be clearly identified,
            specifically concerning: human resource development
            strategies, provision of administrative support, provision
            of academic support, monitoring and supervision activities,
            and, curriculum development. Further lessons address program
            aspects, which should be sequenced, and coordinated
            appropriately; and, systematic data collection, and
            utilization to be continuously monitored, and evaluated.
